dji.sdk.api.Gimbal

Class DJIGimbalRotation

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.Gimbal.DJIGimbalRotation

  • public class DJIGimbalRotation
extends java.lang.Object

    Dji Gimbal Rotation Class

    The DJIGimbalRotation class is the class for controlling the gimbal rotation in three directions, pitch, roll and yaw. It will be used in function updateGimbalAttitude(DJIGimbalRotation, DJIGimbalRotation, DJIGimbalRotation) to adjust the gimabl position.
    Version:
    V2.4.0
    Author:
    DJI Software

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int angle
      This int parameter will provide a signal for gimbal to adjust itself with a specific angle.
         1.If the type is true,
         P2V+ series, the range of angle is [0,1000]
         Inspire 1 / P3 series,the range of angle is [-90,30]
         2.If the type is false,
         P2V+ series, the range of angle is [0,360]
         Inspire 1 / P3 series,the range of value is [-2400,2400], corresponding to the range of the angle [-120, 120]
      boolean direction
      This boolean parameter will determine the direction of gimbal moving.
      For pitching   True: gimbal moving upward when the relative angle value is set positive, moving downward    when the relative value is set negative.
      boolean enable
      This boolean parameter will determine, in a specific direction, whether the gimbal could change or not.
      boolean type
      This boolean parameter will determine the type of gimbal moving module.
        True for absolute angle.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DJIGimbalRotation(boolean mEnable, boolean mDirection, boolean mType, int mAngle)
      Constructor Function

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • enable

        public boolean enable
        This boolean parameter will determine, in a specific direction, whether the gimbal could change or not.

      • direction

        public boolean direction
        This boolean parameter will determine the direction of gimbal moving.
        For pitching   True: gimbal moving upward when the relative angle value is set positive, moving downward    when the relative value is set negative. When the input value is 100, the adjusted angle is 5.
          False: gimbal moving downward when the relative angle value is set positive, moving upward    when the relative value is set negative. When the input value is 100, the adjusted angle is 5.

      • type

        public boolean type
        This boolean parameter will determine the type of gimbal moving module.
          True for absolute angle. The range is among [-90, 30].
          False for relative angle.

      • angle

        public int angle
        This int parameter will provide a signal for gimbal to adjust itself with a specific angle.
           1.If the type is true,
           P2V+ series, the range of angle is [0,1000]
           Inspire 1 / P3 series,the range of angle is [-90,30]
           2.If the type is false,
           P2V+ series, the range of angle is [0,360]
           Inspire 1 / P3 series,the range of value is [-2400,2400], corresponding to the range of the angle [-120, 120]

    • Constructor Detail

      • DJIGimbalRotation

        public DJIGimbalRotation(boolean mEnable,
                         boolean mDirection,
                         boolean mType,
                         int mAngle)
        Constructor Function
        Parameters:
        mEnable - true: enable the rotation false: disable the rotation
        mDirection - When used for pitch, true: upward; false: downward, When used for roll, true: anti-clockwise when you face the camera; false:clockwise when you face the camera. When used for yaw, true: clockwise when you look at the drone from the upside ; false: anti-clockwise when you look at the drone from the upside
        mType - true: the rotation type is using absolute angle. false: the rotation type is using relative angle, if using it continuously, the rotation type is using speed control.
        mAngle - The rotate angle, for the type of absolute angle, the unit is 1 degree/s; for the type of relative angle, the unit is 0.1 degree/s.
